com.appygram.java
Class AppygramMessenger

java.lang.Object
  com.appygram.java.AppygramMessenger

public class AppygramMessenger
extends java.lang.Object

Handles delivery of messages and traces, as well as grabs the topic list. Is bound to a particular Appygram configuration and API Key. Multiples of these can exist in a single application.

Author:
Carl Scott, Solertium Corporation

Method Detail

create

public AppygramMessage create()
Creates a new AppygramMessage based on your configuration settings, setting defaults for fields such as topic, platform, and software. These can then be set manually.

Returns:

createTrace

public AppygramTrace createTrace()
Creates a new AppygramTrace based on your configuration settings, setting defaults for fields such as topic, platform, and software. These can then be set manually.

Returns:

createTrace

public AppygramTrace createTrace(java.lang.Throwable t)
Creates a new AppygramTrace based on your configuration settings, setting defaults for fields such as topic, platform, and software. These can then be set manually. Generates trace information from the supplied exception.

Returns:

addAfterSendHandler

topics

public java.util.List<AppygramTopic> topics()
Load the list of supported topics for your App from Appygram.com

Returns:

trace

public void trace(java.lang.Throwable e)
A convenience method for specifically handling anonymous exceptions. Generates a summary based on the exception message, and message contents containing the stack trace with lines delimited by HTML br tags. If you want a different config for your message, pass in an AppygramTrace object instead.

Parameters:
e -

trace

public void trace(AppygramTrace message)
Send an Appygram exception trace. The AppygramTrace must have a trace attached, but a message is not required.

Parameters:
message -
